title: Propose and apply a nicer app color scheme (light/dark)

requirements.text: Provide 3 distinct, coherent color scheme suggestions for the app (each with a short name and a brief description), and implement one chosen default scheme by updating the appâ€™s theme tokens (CSS variables) so the updated palette applies consistently across the existing UI (header, tabs, cards, buttons, dialogs, gradients) in both light and dark mode.

quotes: Can you give the app a nicer color scheme? You give me the suggestions.

acceptanceCriteria: A short list of 3 color scheme suggestions is included in the change description (name + brief description for each).
One scheme is selected as the default and applied by modifying the existing theme CSS variables in frontend/src/index.css for both :root (light) and .dark (dark).
Primary/secondary/accent/muted/background/foreground/border/ring/destructive/success and chart/sidebar tokens remain defined and produce a cohesive look.

The Login screen background gradient (currently using from-background to muted/20) and key UI surfaces (Header bg-card, Cards, TabsList) visually reflect the new palette without requiring component-by-component hardcoded colors.
Text contrast remains readable in both light and dark mode (e.g., primary buttons have clear primary-foreground contrast; muted-foreground remains legible on muted backgrounds).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or anything in frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Keep theming implemented via existing Tailwind + CSS variable tokens (oklch(var(--...))) rather than introducing a new styling system.
Do not add new authentication providers; Internet Identity remains the only auth mechanism.
nonGoals: Adding new product features or screens beyond updating the visual theme.
Replacing or regenerating existing images (e.g., the login illustration) unless explicitly requested.
